title: why does akali need a speed boost

replies.body:
why does shroud needs to give her back energy?

Why is her E recast global?

Why is shroud duration extended whenever she re-enters it?

That champion has so much unnecessary power its ridiculous.

> [{quoted}](name=Hayaishi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Lw7Htw5N,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-21T04:40:43.570+0000)
>
> why does shroud needs to give her back energy?
> 
> Why is her E recast global?
> 
> Why is shroud duration extended whenever she re-enters it?
> 
> That champion has so much unnecessary power its ridiculous.

- Because all energy champs need a way to regen energy since there's literally no other way besides blue buff. 
- Does it matter ? Very easy to counter since you know where she's landing
- Because that's the duration her shroud was pre-rework
- Unnecessary power, maybe. But I pref this to pre-rework Akali who destroyed you post-6 instantly. Old akali almost never ran out of energy with her chain Qs.

Because you can't put it on Q, and E is already rewarding enough. Every other Energy champion has a Energy refund somewhere in their kit. Putting it on her shroud, once again, rewards aggression, since you're now in a better spot to attack. 

Because it's actually hard to hit, and much easier to dodge, not to mention her time to kill still being much lower from her rework. 

Because it's meant to encourage it to be used *Offensively*, as opposed to a "I'll never die from ganks because I hold onto my shroud." By rewarding players for aggression, you actually create more periods in which you can take advantage of Akali, as they'll be using their safety tools aggresively (Like TF using his Gold Card, or Syndra using her knockback/Stun). 

But stuff like that is too hard to think of, when you can just bitch for nerfs, aye? CertainlyT makes extremely complex champs, that have a bunch of gears and cranks, to allow them to work in a way. Realistically, the real argument is, "Should these champs have to be so complex with needing X many parts just to function" not "This champ has too much power."

League of legends boards: “Wtf why is this champion so strong”

Except for professor akali, none of the Akali *mains* are happy. She is a gimmicky champion with clunky gameplay that perhaps in the right hands and in optimal or niche situations can be strong.

She isn’t necessarily a garbage champion, but she surely isn’t strong. What she is is annoying to play against AND *as.* 

I don’t know why when reworking assassins, Riot absolutely fucking *has* to make the champion shit to play as and against.

TL;DR: while not strong, she feels horrible to play as and against. I would even say she isn’t a true CertainlyT champion, simply because she’s not fun to play either.

It's really not almost entirely covered, that is a glorified hyperbole to help your argument. There is really about 3 Akali mains that regularly repost asking for a revert. This Shobek guy is the worst offender imo.

She feels great to play imo, they just don't want the old Akali to be gone and are too butthurt to face reality. I would say most of the Akali mains are happy and her rework brought a new playerbase to the champion as well. I for one wholeheartedly love the rework even after playing and loving the old Akali since s4. 

Your post is entirely a biased opinion. Just because she feels shitty to play to you doesn't mean she necessarily feels bad to someone else.

Riot shouldn't rework champions and take them away from players who love them. Its really f'd up. 

Its so easy to balance things. The original Akali was fine; they didn't try anything to reduce how fast she put out damage like increasing cooldowns. They just gutted her and changed her kit a bunch of times and then reworked her into something that doesnt feel the same at all. 

This new champion is cool sure. But it is not Akali. 

I'm very happy to be the worst offender by your perception. A testament to my love of the original Akali.

Listen, I've got no problem with you personally, but they aren't going to revert her so I don't see the point in struggling. I would've preferred a revert back to before rickless abandon. I figured when they gave her a VGU it couldn't be worse than her assassin update, and imo it was much more of a success comparatively. 

I loved the old Akali, but I was also open to the VGU and looking forward to it after the assassin update because it was a way they could add more skill expression and outplay mechanics into her kit. I loved the old Akali aesthetic but she did need an update imo, she was a binary, statcheck champion that was unhealthy for the game. Fun as hell, but unhealthy. 

Gameplay wise she still feels similar to me, and matches my playstyle so I didn't have to many qualms with her new kit. New voice was a bit of a disappointment but I got used to it and now I like it. Her visuals are beautiful, I love the new direction they went with her, with the tattoos and hair. She's not meant to be the same Akali we knew and loved, she's meant to be an Akali two years in the future after learning new tricks and such.

I get that you don't think the new rework is similar to Akali enough, but I do, and I like it. It sucks that you aren't happy with the rework but Riot can't please everyone. I don't think making the new Akali a new champ and reverting back to old akali would work either, because they wanted old Akali out of the game, otherwise they wouldn't have constantly gutted her. Feels bad.

The old Akali was fine. I'm not convinced. If they wanted to nerf her all they ever had to do was to add more cooldown to her ultimate. Her burst was already one of the hardest to get off for any assassin. 

Her linear straight forward point and click playstyle was complicated by the fact that she had to auto attack to proc her q and also auto attack a second time to get her damage proc off with her passive; this required a different type of skill & combo management that the game is now lacking as they continue to homogenize champions and streamline the game. Not a single other champion feels like she felt. Not even Diana.

I'm going to continue to speak my opinion; that's all it is. 

This game is dead to me for the time being until I can accept this rework. After over 5000 Akali games; I just don't know if I can.

This new champion should just be a separate champion. The original akali was totally fine; This new one is completely busted.

1 . a shroud that players can use pink wards on 
2 . a passive of spell vamp / magic damage 
3 . and an e that proc's q ( oh we just loved the combo's We just loved them so much) 

Then just put a long cd on her ult like 2.5-3.5 seconds or something. Whatever. If you want to lengthen her burst window that is seriously all that is needed. Longer cd on her ultimate; and give her shroud the weakness it always had so that she has more counter-play.

It's a better Lee Q since it has infinite dash range once marking the enemy, also it gives a backdash which can be used as mobility in and of itself too (Akali often uses it to cross over walls just like any other dash abilities but merely used in reverse direction) which Lee certainly doesn't have (not in Q anyway, and his W also requires a ward or ally unit of sort instead of just being a free-directional dash). Akali's E is like a combined version of Lee's Q and W, but with better boons and less drawbacks too; it's clearly not a "worse Lee Q".

So in total her mobility and self-peel capabilities are as follows: 1 zoning tool giving absolute and 0 counterplay stealth that covers the entire lane, 3 free-directional dashes in total including ulti, and 1 mark-chase with infinite range. This is not even counting her also having 3 separate instances of MS steroids in her kits, too. I don't know about you but this is utterly ridiculous.
